edu.pitt.dbmi.facebase.hd
Class HumanDataManager

java.lang.Object
  edu.pitt.dbmi.facebase.hd.HumanDataManager

public class HumanDataManager
extends java.lang.Object

Performs human data related operations. Manages access to encryption keys. Creates encryption keys. Gathers user-requested SQL data from human data server's mysql database via Hibernate, extracts data to CSV

Constructor Summary

          Sets up Hibernate connection to human data server's mysqlDB

Method Detail

sanitizeSql

public java.lang.String sanitizeSql(java.lang.String suspectUserSql)
Sanitize SQL string by checking it for bad words Does not repair SQL--only causes it to not be executed.

Parameters:
suspectUserSql - the provided SQL query string (ie SELECT * FROM table)
Returns:
value "OK" if ok, otherwise it tosses a status="error" condition and returns a bad string.

getCsvData

public java.lang.String getCsvData(java.lang.String userSql)
Use provided SQL query string to query database and build CSV-formatted String Sanitizes provided SQL query strings. Converts JDBC ResultSet object to CSV String data--two mechanisms are contained in this source file, one is commented out.
  1. Manually parsing each row in the ResultSet object and printing a line to an accumulating String of CSV data
  2. Using au.com.bytecode.opencsv.CSVWriter to convert the ResultSet to String--this STILL requires manually parsing to obtain the header row column names
Both schemes can produce usable CSV data...as of Jan2012, CSVWriter mechanism is being used. Both schemes populate a String in memory. Thus large ResultSets could crash the program by overconsuming memory--if large ResultSets are required, this program should be edited to instead buffer the data to a file

Parameters:
userSql - the provided SQL query string (ie SELECT * FROM table)
Returns:
double-quote delimited CSV data as a String where the first line has column-name header row, all subsequent rows are data
